e187364b-0594-4fbc-989b-19de1faa625f.description: Earners of the Certified Medical Publication Professional™ credential have demonstrated proficiency in all aspects of good publication practice in the field of medical publications related to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device research. They are knowledgeable of best practices in developing and implementing a publication plan, and uphold and understand how to foster ethical and compliant behaviors in publication planning.
e187364b-0594-4fbc-989b-19de1faa625f.name: Certified Medical Publication Professional™

issuer.summary: issued by International Society for Medical Publication Professionals

entity.name: International Society for Medical Publication Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college/university or an equivalent educational degree OR High School Diploma or an equivalent.

4,000 hours (equivalent of 2 years of full-time work) if hold Bachelor's Degree OR 10,000 hours (equivalent of 5 years of full-time work) for High School Diploma of active, verifiable employment predominantly involving developing a publication plan, implementing a publication plan, fostering ethical and compliant behavior in publications, and monitoring trends related to the medical publication profession.
Earn a passing score on the CMPP examination, a computer-based, 150-question, multiple-choice test.
